body.p: The SolidFire storage system is an interconnection of hardware and software designed for large-scale, multi-tenant cloud environments where the performance, quailty-of-service and scale present different challenges than those in a traditional enterprise deployment. SolidFire relies on Cinder, an OpenStack service that manages the creation, attaching, and detaching of block storage volumes between a storage system like SolidFire and different host servers.

If you already have SolidFire deployed in your environment and want to integrate its storage with Helion OpenStack, you can use this document to understand how testers have successfully completed the process. The process involves meeting all of the hardware and network requirements, and configuring SolidFire as a single back-end. Additionally, this topic provides sample test scenarios that have been used to verify integration with Helion OpenStack.
The following operations supported by SolidFire were confirmed to also be supported by Helion OpenStack.

li.b: Create, delete, attach, and detach volumes
Copy an image to a volume
Create, list, and delete volume snapshots
Create a volume from a snapshot

body.note: The Cinder supported operations are listed in the Cinder Support Matrix
